website_summaries.verdict: Huge viewing area that allows you to see what you're working on with fast auto darkening feature.
pros: One of the largest viewing areas you'll find in the market at 3.85 inches by 3.15 inches
Includes a solar charging option to ensure you always have power to run the helmet
Works quickly to darken the viewing area when needed
Both blue and orange colored helmets available
cons: Not made for all-day welding work

customer_reviews.title: i was not expecting anything amazing out of this helmet for 70$
customer_reviews.text: i was not expecting anything amazing out of this helmet for 70$, but i was very pleasantly surprised. The window is very large and the helmet fits great. adjustments are easy to make and it stays on better then my snap on helmet. lens changes are cake and the settings are easy to adjust even with gloves on. Im sure it wont last as long as my snap on helmet will, but considering i could buy 5 of these for the cost of one of those, i think this is an excellent helmet, especially for someone who is learning or doesent need to weld every day.
customer_reviews.author: j

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: sometimes does not dim right away... i think i am going blind now. i have not had to get replacement lenses yet. it comes with a few. the worst thing about the helmet is the head gear it is junk. the thumb screws stripped and the detents that hold the hood up broke off completely. the detents that stop it from hitting you in the face broken as well. helmet delay is delay from dark to light not light to dark which got me a few times with a blinding flash.
customer_reviews.author: Curt

customer_reviews.title: Will not stay dark for TIG
customer_reviews.text: Update: This helmet will fundamentally not stay dark for TIG work. I don't know if it's defective or just designed that way. It seems to require changes in light level to stay dark, which is fine for MIG or stick spattering along, but no good for a stable TIG arc. I was able to stick some spring steel in place over the test switch and just use it as a non-auto-darkening helmet, and finish the work confirming, that it's really just the helmet acting up.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Read the instruction booklet.
customer_reviews.text: Read the instruction booklet! I didn't check the Weld/Gring switch hidden near top of the lens on the inside and couldn't get the helmet to darken fully. My bad. Should always read the instructions even if you "already know." It's a nice helmet if lightly constructed. Component fit was not perfect when first installing the head strap into the housing, but it worked. Very good for casual or occasional use. Good price.
customer_reviews.author: BKerr

customer_reviews.title: Might work at higher amperage but if you want to tig low amp I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: The adjustment pins that hold the helmet off your face broke on the first flip. Tried using for tig welding at around 40 amps and a few seconds after iniatiating arc the lens would continuously flash. Tried all adjustments with no improvement. Might work at higher amperage but if you want to tig low amp I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Best for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This helmet does everything well and the large window makes it so much easier to weld. It is clearer than most I have used and darkens perfectly with arc. Certainly the best I have seen under $100.

I've used big name brand hoods that are pretty expensive (300.00-400.00) and so far this hood has been great. Although the little adjustment tabs for how far up or down it stops on your far broke off. No biggie, just drilled it out and put rivets in. Great hood. Would definitely buy it again.

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: It works very well with my arc welder. Also, the head gear had a locking position when you put the helmet up and would fall quite nicely with a nod of the head. That was plastic and broke in the first project I used the hood for. Not a huge deal you simply tighten the pivot screws like any other helmet until it falls how you like it, but an example of the quality for sure.
